page.title: 19PARISH SCHOOL
page.content: A PAROCHIAL SCHOOL IS MENTIONED IN WHELLAN'S DIRECTORY OF 1849.IT WAS A CHURCH SCHOOL,AND WAS FOR A TIME HELD IN A HOUSE AT THE TOP OF EASTON LANE. IN 1857,A NATIONAL SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN MILE STREET.THE TEACHERS WERE MISS KEZIAH JONES,REV.PIZEY AND MRS. PIZEY. AFTER THE EDUCATION ACT OF 1870,A SCHOOL BOARD WAS FORMED IN 1871,AND A NEW SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN CAMDEN SQUARE. THE SITE COST 300 POUNDS AND THE BUILDINGS WERE 2150 POUNDS.IT WAS BUILT FOR 250 CHILDREN. THE PRESENT SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1973 AND ISIN HARROLD ROAD ON THE SITE OF AN OLD POND!THERE ARE 6 CLASSROOMS AND A MOBILE.THERE IS A HALL,OFFICE SECTION, LIBRARY AND 2 PLAYGROUNDS.THE PLAYING FIELDS ARE USED FOR GAMES.THERE ARE 7 TEACHERS AND A HEADTEACHER.THERE ARE 195 CHILDREN ON ROLL.
